greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = largest k such that A001563(k) divides n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..4320
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{a = {{0, n}}}, Do[AppendTo[a, {First@ #, Last@ #} &@ QuotientRemainder[a[[-1, -1]], (# #!) &[# - i]]], {i, 0, # - 1}] &@ NestWhile[# + 1 &, 0, (# #!) &[# + 1] <= n &]; Rest[a][[All, 1]]]; Table[Length@ TakeWhile[Reverse@ f@ n, # == 0 &] + 1, {n, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 31 2016 *)
program: (Scheme) (define (A276329 n) (let loop ((i (A258198 n))) (cond ((zero? i) 1) ((zero? (modulo n (A001563 i))) i) (else (loop (- i 1))))))
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 30 2016
